Case reference: 2018008636.CaseDesc: On February 6, 2018, at approximately 11:30pm, Guerman Pouchkine was last seen in the area of Steels Avenue West and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004678.CaseDesc: On January 23, 1996, at approximately 4:30pm, Isaac and Sara Floresquintana were last seen at their mother’s home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021000934.CaseDesc: On January 25, 2002, Vincent Lamouris was seen for the last time near the American Falls in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Vincent was despondent.

Shoes: Black, Dress shoes; brand: Mephisto; with a buckle on the side
Sweater: Wool, Black, Long sleeves; Ralph Lauren logo on the chest
Watch: White, Wrist watch; brand: Rodania; with a black leather strap

Case reference: 2014006135.CaseDesc: In December 2012, Victor Pedtchenko was last seen in the area of 55 Triller Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Victor had not been seen for one month before being reported missing.

Case reference: 2023055905.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2023, Robert Sam (Whitey) McKEAN was reported missing in Whistler, British Columbia. Robert was walking his dog Lexi, a 15-year-old white and ginger Cavalier, in Whistler's Alpine neighbourhood. Robert and his dog were last seen on video surveillance footage from a neighboring construction site at the end of Alpine Way, where Robert entered the trail but did not exit. Robert was also suffering from dementia, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004671.CaseDesc: Murphy Quill was last seen in mid-July 2005. His family and friends are concerned for his well being as it is unusual for him to be out of contact for this length of time. Although he does not have a fixed address, Mr. Quill is known to frequent the Main Street strip and the area near 75 Martha Street in Winnipeg, MB.

Case reference: 2020036483.CaseDesc: Dorothy Cox was seen for the last time between the months of December 1942 and April 1943 in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014004087.CaseDesc: On October 31, 1996, James Withers was last seen at his family's residence.

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2018005158.CaseDesc: Darryl Langan was last seen on Highway 10 on January 19th, 2018, walking from Melville to Yorkton, Saskatchewan, in the vicinity of the community of Otthon (between Melville and Yorkton, Saskatchewan).

Case reference: 2014001606.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1986, Sarah Pelletier was last seen in Montreal, Québec. Witnesses saw her jump off the Jacques-Cartier Bridge into the Saint-Lawrence River at approximately 9:00 p.m. Sarah hasn't been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2018063007.CaseDesc: On November 18, 1998, Anne Smythe was seen for the last time by her daughter, in Toronto, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Anne was headed in the direction of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002126.CaseDesc: On March 18, 1997, Mark Bird was seen for the last time when he left his home in Welland, Ontario. His abandoned vehicle was later found in Niagara Falls. At the time of his disappearance, Mark was despondent and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Black, Hooded, San Francisco 49's football team

Case reference: 2017070398.CaseDesc: Randy Whitcher was seen for the last time on November 29, 2017 at approximately 10 a.m. in the 11000 Block of the Westminster Highway in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck
Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2014003446.CaseDesc: Dawn Crey was a resident of the downtown east side of Vancouver; she was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was reported missing on December 11, 2000 after failing to attend a medical appointment. Foul play is suspected in Ms. Crey's disappearance.

Case reference: 2011000399.CaseDesc: Kathy Bordato was reported missing in early February, 2010.  Police believe that she was last seen on or about August 16, 2009, between 7:00 and 8:30 am in the area of Cavendish Park near Walnut Street in London, Ontario. Police conducted a search of the area where Ms. Bordato was last seen and believe there are still witnesses with information to offer in relation to the investigation.

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tattoo of female  symbol between thumb and finger, left hand

Case reference: 2014005046.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2007, at approximately 3:45 p.m., Remi Bouchard was seen for the last time on a floatation device in the Bow River near Calgary, Alberta. Remi disappeared into the water after being trapped at the base of the weir.

Case reference: 2016000962.CaseDesc: On January 5, 2016, Felix Claveau was last seen when he jumped off the Viau Bridge into the Rivière-des-Prairies in Laval, Quebec. Felix hasn’t been seen since.

Case reference: 2024035640.CaseDesc: Barry Auguste was last seen on February 9, 2024, in the area of Horner Ave and Evans Ave. He is known to be in the downtown area of Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth
Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2017023444.CaseDesc: In July 1948, June Pauline Stevens was living in Cadillac, Saskatchewan when she disappeared and has not been heard from since. June was thought to have travelled west to Port Alberni, British Columbia to join her mother or to Winnipeg, Manitoba to join other relatives.

Case reference: 2014003002.CaseDesc: Roger Paul Bertrand left his residence on November 11, 1999, between the hours of 10:00 and 11:30 am. He appeared nervous a week prior to his disappearance due to an upcoming commitment. He was on a disability pension and suffered from back and leg problems which required a brace and a cane to walk.  He left behind his brace and cane at his residence. It appears that Mr. Bertrand may have been a victim of foul play.

Jacket: Leather, Black, With buckles and zippers
Tattoo: Left Hand, Raccoon between the thumb and finger.

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2006006399.CaseDesc: Gerald Joseph Bouchard was last seen on the morning of June 4, 1998, in the Town of Moosonee, Ontario. Moosonee is a remote Northern Ontario community situated on the coast of James Bay. There are no roads to Moosonee and access is by rail or aircraft. It is believed that Mr. Bouchard may have left Moosonee by jumping on a rail boxcar.

Case reference: 2014002517.CaseDesc: Hélène Laferrière was seen for the last time on November 4, 1976, in the Saint-Sacrement District in Quebec City, Quebec. Hélène has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2014002336.CaseDesc: On March 22, 1993, Yolande Bouchard was going to meet her sister at the mall in Trois-Rivières at 4:00 p.m. She never arrived and was reported missing at that time. Her car was later found in Trois-Rivières Ouest with two offence tickets on the windshield.

Case reference: 2014003835.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1992, Janice Howe left her family home in Winnipeg, Manitoba driving her father's 1985 Oldsmobile Cierra, and has not been seen since. Janice's vehicle was located the following morning 19 km east of Kenora, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020018331.CaseDesc: Riley Berland went missing from Frog Lake, Alberta, on May 31, 2020. Riley's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2014005323.CaseDesc: Darrell Hoshowski was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta, in July 1983. Prior to his disappearance, Darrell had made a withdrawal from his bank account. There is reason to believe that he may have travelled to Vancouver, British Columbia or possibly to the State of California, in the USA.

Case reference: 2021056747.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2021, at approximately 12:45AM, Nivethan Alakeswaran was last seen leaving their residence in Brampton, Ontario. Nivethan's family last heard from him at approximately 7:00AM the same day.  Nivethan has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Navy jacket with brown fur on the hood

Case reference: 2014005200.CaseDesc: Conrad Hastings was last seen at the bus shelter at Smith Street and Portage Avenue.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2023009705.CaseDesc: Paul Davis was last seen on November 5, 2022 when he went swimming off of the shores of Saint John West near the Bay Ferry dock in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000101.CaseDesc: Oswald Bear departed from his parents' residence in Peguis First Nation, Manitoba on October 19, 1969 with the intention of harvesting wood in a nearby forest. Oswald was well-acquainted with the area and enjoyed the task of chopping wood. He had spent a considerable amount of time in the area and was intimately familiar with it. He had never been lost in the bush and had never failed to return home previously. At 6:15 p.m., he visited his sister's residence, which was located nearby. His sister advised him to return home shortly thereafter to alleviate their mother's concern. Oswald left his sister's residence with the intention of returning home, but he was not seen again.

Case reference: 2014006160.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1978, George Heys left his residence for an appointment in Toronto, Ontario. George has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2006023699.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Turtle was last seen in Pikangikum in the Squirrel Rock area in Ontario on July 4, 2005. Information received indicated that Mr. Turtle was going to a sand pit area approximately 3 km northwest of Pikangikum.

Hat: Blue, Red, BALL CAP, Red "C", Size Large
Sweater: HOODED, Size XL, Black, Red And White

Case reference: 2020016024.CaseDesc: In July of 2019, Anita Grace Wechsler was seen and heard from for the last time in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of Anita’s disappearance, she may have been despondent and involved in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014006397.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2014, Joshua Jeffs was reported missing in Revelstoke, British Columbia. On December 19, 2013, a vehicle driven by Joshua was located unoccupied at the entrance to a popular outdoor recreation area known as "12 Mile", south of Revelstoke, British Columbia. Joshua has not been seen or heard from since.

Pants: Black, Trackpants with white stripes along the sides
Shirt: Black, Dark Blue, Sweatshirt, Hooded Sweatshirt with white writing
Grey, T-Shirt, T-shirt worn underneath SPURS Jersey
White, Jersey, Spurs white basketball jersey with #9 on the front
Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Text “4LIFE”, back of right arm
Left Upper Arm, Text “DEUCE”, back of left arm
Left Forearm, Text “NORTH SIDE MOB MASK FACE”

Case reference: 2006016399.CaseDesc: Noriharu Amano was last seen on July 24, 2005 at the airport on Airport Road in Sault Ste. Marie. He left in a Cessna C-172 aircraft which had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red. The Cessna was last heard from as it was circling over Goulais Bay.

Case reference: 2006014699.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1996, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Melanie Ethier was seen for the last time as she left a friend’s residence to walk to her residence in New Liskeard, Ontario. The distance between her home and her friend’s residence was a kilometre, but Melanie never arrived home. Foul play is suspected.

Shirt: Cotton, White, a blue heart ("Pepe" logo) t-shirt

Case reference: 2014036537.CaseDesc: On 2 October 2014, a vehicle was located abandoned at 53122 Range Road 194 in Yellowhead County, Alberta. The investigation concluded that Natasha Klok was an occupant of that vehicle and that she went into a nearby heavily forested area. Natasha has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014016772.CaseDesc: On July 6, 2014 around 1PM, Yvon Guevin left his residence in Pierreville, Quebec with his vehicle, a burgundy and gray Jeep Cherokee registered in Quebec. He left with his little black dog, a "miniature Pinscher" named Costaud. His family and friends have not seen or heard from him since, which is out of the ordinary.

Case reference: 2017073542.CaseDesc: On November 4, 2016, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario in St. Catharines, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of East Asian Ancestry.

Case reference: 2006026399.CaseDesc: Kathy Anne Lulloff was last seen wandering off into the woods off Seabrook Lake Road in the District of Algoma.

Case reference: 2012020121.CaseDesc: Mathieu Beauregard Messier was alone at home with his wife. At approximately 7:00 p.m., Mathieu told his wife he had to go see a friend and that he would be back later in the evening. He left alone in his wife’s vehicle and with her cellphone. At approximately 10:30 p.m., police received a call that a vehicle was on fire on Rang du Haut-de-la-Rivière, near the military base in Farnham, Quebec. The vehicle was identified as that of Mathieu’s wife. There was nobody inside the vehicle, and Mathieu has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003608.CaseDesc: Brianne Wolgram was last seen on the evening of September 5, 1998, in Revelstoke, British Columbia.  Ms. Wolgram had plans to socialize with friends that evening but did not attend.  Ms. Wolgram's vehicle was located on September 10, 1998 on the Alkolkolex Forest Service Road near Revelstoke.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020111.CaseDesc: On July 15 2010, James Daniel Khan left the family home for a walk and never returned. He suffers from mental health problems and he left without his medication.

Case reference: 2015011654.CaseDesc: On December 3, 1994, a baby was found in the Rivière des Prairies between the island of Montréal and the Visitation park Island in the Ahuntsic neighborhood. The body was naked and had a plastic bag wrapped around the wrist. According to experts the body would have been in the water since the fall.

Case reference: 2021060022.CaseDesc: Erin Brooks had been last seen by her family on December 24th, 2021, and her roommate on December 27th, 2021. Erin was observed later on that particular day at the St-Mary's Smoke Shop in Sitansisk (St-Mary's First Nation), New Brunswick.

Tattoo: Right Wrist, Unknown tattoo in black ink
Left Forearm, Unknown tattoo in black ink
Back Of Neck, Four black turtles
Left Chest, Text "BOO" in blue ink

Case reference: 2022031763.CaseDesc: Shortly after midnight on December 27, 1980, Paul Elliott was seen for the last time near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Pants: Brown, Corduroy, May have been wearing corduroy pants
Blue, JEANS, May have been wearing jeans
Shirt: Blue, T-SHIRT, The brand may have possibly been Levis

Case reference: 2009003999.CaseDesc: At about 1 p.m. Robert Aho of North Bay left Land O’Lakes Cottages located in Martin River and headed west bound on Highway 64 towards Field. He was carrying a packsack and duffle bag and has not been in contact with his family since.

Shirt: Blue, White, Long sleeved, Toronto Maple Leaf

Case reference: 2006022699.CaseDesc: Nick Hibbart was prospecting when he was last seen by police at his camp on Gravel River on June 8, 1988. Police returned to the area on July 25, 1988, and found that the camp was burned to the ground. There was no sign of Mr. Hibbart and investigations have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2022027245.CaseDesc: Anne Lenning was last seen in December, 1992, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018020022.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1968, Jacqueline Lefebvre was last seen while she was at the family cottage in Mascouche, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014003015.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1984 Donald Williamson's brother reported him as missing since September 6th. He has a history of disappearing without maintaining contact with his family. There is no foul play suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014001879.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Patrick Auger left his residence in Desmarais, Alberta, to travel to Slave Lake, Alberta. On November 1, 1983, Patrick was observed getting onto a Greyhound Bus bound for Peace River, Alberta, from Slave Lake.

Deformity: Right Fourth Toe, Deformed from previous fracture
Right Large Toe, Toe twisted from healed fracture

Case reference: 2023014476.CaseDesc: Paul Hahn left his Amherst, New York home on April 21st, 2022 to go kayaking on Lake Ontario near Golden State Hill Park, New York, USA. At the time of his disappearance, he was in possession of an orange and black Old Towne Sportsman motorized 120 kayak. His vehicle was located unoccupied in the state park however Paul has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004298.CaseDesc: On June 25, 2002, Spencer Shinjo Aoki left his apartment in Vancouver, British Columbia and never returned. Spencer did not take any personal items with him and left behind things that were of high value to him.

Case reference: 2014005882.CaseDesc: Romeo Cloutier was last seen September 13, 2012 in Moncton (NB). His vehicle was located in Sainte-Marie-de-Kent later on that same day. No other confirmed reports of his whereabouts have been made since.

Tattoo: Neck, Inscription "Keep your friends close, keep enemies closer"

Case reference: 2014006556.CaseDesc: On the 23rd of July, 2006, Preston Waldner was swimming at Paradise Beach, South Saskatchewan River, when he and another fellow were attempting to swim across the river. The boys got part way across when they ran into trouble due to the very strong current of the river. The one fellow was pulled from the river and survived, however Preston was seen going under and he never resurfaced. A search was conducted but he has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Chest, Howling wolf with the initial "PWW" above the wolf

Case reference: 2014002598.CaseDesc: Tina Fang Chen arrived in Canada from China in May 2000 and stayed in Mississauga Ontario for approximately 3 weeks, until her disappearance on June 9, 2000.  It is believed that she had the intention to enter the USA and was possibly headed for New York State.

Case reference: 2014001643.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1989, Diane Racicot was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Diana left a farewell letter in the family home. She left without a change of clothes and with very little money. Diane speaks four languages.

Case reference: 2021007962.CaseDesc: Robert Hutchison was seen for the last time in Winnipeg, Manitoba. On January 30, 2021, Robert contacted his family for the last time. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Left Wrist, Birthmark red dots under wrist
Scar: Shoulders, Several scars on right shoulder (clavicle)

Case reference: 2019009625.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, Nikhil Arun was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2017074234.CaseDesc: On February 27, 2016 an unidentified male believed to be between the ages of 40 to 75 years old was discovered in Jayfield Park in Brampton, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001943.CaseDesc: Kam Lee was last seen in the Bishop Grandin and River Road area of Winnipeg, MB.  Mr. Lee's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020025.CaseDesc: At about 8:15 pm on May 3, 1983, 16 year old Shelley-Anne Bacsu left a friend’s house in the Sunset Trailer Park to walk the 7 km to her home. Her route took her west on Highway 16 through Hinton, then north on Highway 40. Witnesses saw Shelley-Anne walking westbound along the shoulder of Highway 16 carrying her school books; she was not hitch-hiking. Shelley-Anne was last seen in the area of what was then the western edge of town. A dark colored van was seen in the area around the time Shelley-Anne was walking home, some reports were that it was stopped at the side of the road near where she was last seen. An extensive search for the van and/or its occupants was not successful. Several days after Shelley-Anne was last seen, some of her belongings were found near the Athabasca River not far from the outskirts of Hinton.

Case reference: 2020013402.CaseDesc: On May 2, 2020, Vincent Turcotte was for the last time in the Parc des Berges area of Clermont, Quebec. The bike he was riding was found near the Malbaie River.

Hair: Auburn, Short, Sports a moustache and a little beard
Shoes: Light Green, NIKE AIRJO, "Nike Air Jordan" brand, camouflage
Sweater: Black, Green, HOODIE, Hooded sweatshirt, text "Les Beaux Projects"
Tattoo: Right Hand, Unknown text on fingers

Case reference: 2017064837.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2017, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Mélissa Blais was seen for the last time in Louiseville, Quebec. Prior to her disappearance, Mélissa had driven to Louiseville’s downtown area in her 2011 black Toyota Corolla, license plate Quebec Y70 FAD, to spend the evening there. Her vehicle has never been found.

Tattoo: Left Shoulder, Heart and wings; letters "JO"

Case reference: 2014001072.CaseDesc: On July 19 1984, the body of a male believed to be between the ages of 18-29 was found in the waters of the Fraser River near Boston Bar, British Columbia. He had some crowding on his upper teeth and no tattoos or obvious scars. It is believed he was deceased for a few months prior to his remains being recovered.

Case reference: 2017047885.CaseDesc: On July 31, 2017, Brayden Thibault was seen for the last time when he left Fredericton, New Brunswick to meet someone in the city of Moncton, New Brunswick. Brayden has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003528.CaseDesc: Kate Huyghe was last seen in Killam, Alberta on February 21, 1976.

Boots: Leather, Black, winter boot with suede fur tops
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, family ring with colored stone

Case reference: 2014004097.CaseDesc: On March 1, 1996, Joseph Walter was last seen at the Cozy Corner Lounge in High Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2021055828.CaseDesc: Penny Yaroshuk was last seen leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on the morning of December 1st, 2021. Penny's vehicle was located abandoned in Hermitage Park, Edmonton, at 12:50 p.m. that same day. Family and friends have not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2018015227.CaseDesc: On March 22, 2018, at approximately 1:00pm, Maria Ruiz Zein was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Maria boarded a flight to go to Colombia, but has not returned to Canada.

Case reference: 2014001540.CaseDesc: Marie Laliberté was a resident of east Vancouver who was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was last seen by her resource worker on January 1, 1997. Due to her increasingly sporadic contact with family and a lack of social interaction with others, she was not reported missing until March 8, 2002.

Case reference: 2014001464.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 16, 1989, Vincent Greene entered a wooded area behind his residence on the Red Head Rd, Saint John, NB, to search for the family dog. The dog returned shortly after he had left, but Vincent never returned.  An extensive ground search was conducted with negative results. Anyone with information is urged to contact the Saint John Police Force.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Steel rimmed
Jewelry: Gold, Wedding Ring, Lines on both sides

Case reference: 2020008363.CaseDesc: On August 16, 1981, at approximately 1:00pm, Dick Yeagar was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Dick had been evicted from his apartment on August 15, and did not show up to work the following day.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen on July 11, 1977 while climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2014005017.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1967, Margaret Mildred Batoche was reported missing from her family residence in Bonnyville, Alberta. Margaret always kept in contact with her family and friends, and her disappearance is considered suspicious.

Mark: Cheek, Wart on right cheek close to ear

Case reference: 2014002960.CaseDesc: David Wycotte was last seen by his family on November 1, 1975, in Williams Lake, British Columbia. Up until December 1975, David was working in Winfield, British Columbia as a berry picker. David has been known to travel the area and the United States looking for labour jobs.

Case reference: 2012020023.CaseDesc: Melanie Thomson was last seen on August 27, 2010. Melanie's last known address was in the downtown east side of Vancouver, B.C.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2020009419.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1989, at approximately 12:00pm, Jessica Sakouhi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Jessica was visiting from France and was due to return back on August 19, but she did not board the plane.

Case reference: 2021052226.CaseDesc: On January 28, 2016, at approximately 1:45 p.m., Daniel Leslie was last seen at Terrapin Point, on the American side of Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls State Park, New York. During the time of his disappearance, Daniel was despondent.

Case reference: 2018063020.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1997, Donghui Zhao was last heard from when he spoke with his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Donghui had not been seen or heard from for three months before his disappearance was reported.
